results.title: World of Pets
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Sidney Platt and Alan Degen
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a particular pet and shows how you can learn about animal behavior through the care of animals. The programs also give tips on how to look after pets.

results.title: World of pets
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Sidney Platt
results.brief_description: This series looks at the main issues facing children in regards to the care and treatment of the most popular animals they may wish to keep as pets. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students.

results.title: World of little things
results.creator_credit: Moody Institute of Science. Educational Film Division
results.brief_description: Looks at the historical background of the microscope and studies the life forms often found in a drop of water - amoeba, volvox, paramecium, and didinium. Also shows the structure and nature of other marine life such as medusa and flatworms.

results.title: World of darkness
results.brief_description: Edited from the motion picture entitled ‘Strange creatures of the night’, the film examines a variety of creatures, including bats, owls, and a blind lizard that live and hunt in the darkness. Excellent footage of the animals in their natural environment. There is an information booklet inside each can.

results.title: World of commerce
results.creator_credit: Golden Fleece, Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Bruce McNaughton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Illustrates the range of occupations in the busy world of commerce available to both boys and girls. Gives examples of occupations in banking and other financial jobs associated with production, marketing and transport. Considers the need for documents, systems of book keeping and administrative skills required, and gives advice on training opportunities for commercial careers.

results.title: World of change: world of promise
results.creator_credit: Cinemakers, Carol Hale and William B. Hartigan
results.brief_description: Shows the contribution of the World Association of Girl Guides to the changing role of Women in all countries. The work of guides in four contrasting countries - India, Finland, Paraguay and Acapulco - is shown. Despite the different approaches to guiding, the common goals of community awareness and self-improvement are universal.

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray Production and Satyajit Ray
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.
